intro: Hedyotis vachellii, commonly known as the small flame vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or climbing vine, featuring opposite, elliptic leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Hedyotis vachellii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
